title: Built for the Snow
fact: The snow leopard's thick fur, wide paws, and long tail act like nature's perfect winter gear, allowing it to survive temperatures as low as -40°C in the icy peaks of Central Asia.

title: Master of the Mountains
fact: Living at altitudes up to 5,500 meters, snow leopards navigate sheer cliffs and rugged terrain with the grace of a dancer and the precision of a mountaineer.

title: The Ghost Cat
fact: Known as the 'Ghost of the Mountains,' the snow leopard’s pale coat and elusive nature make it almost invisible in its snowy kingdom.

title: Tail Like a Blanket
fact: Its incredibly long, fluffy tail is more than just a balance tool—it wraps around the snow leopard’s body like a scarf during freezing nights.

title: Silent Hunter
fact: Snow leopards can leap up to 15 meters in a single bound, ambushing prey without making a sound in the thin mountain air.

title: Solitary Royalty
fact: Each snow leopard rules its own vast territory, sometimes stretching over 200 square kilometers, rarely crossing paths with another of its kind.

title: Vanishing Treasure
fact: With only an estimated 4,000 to 6,500 individuals left in the wild, the snow leopard is a rare jewel of nature that the world is fighting to protect.
